results.title: Celebrations of people and place : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: The East Reservoir Neighbourhood Renewal was set up in 2006 when the area was identified as being in need and enabling residents to help create a community action plan. Part of this process has been to invite seven members of the community to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop to tell very personal stories the reflect life in the suburb.
results.title_for_label: Celebrations of people and place : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: You really had to be there!
results.creator_credit: Dean Turner, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dean Turner cherishes the Punk Rock nights at the Arthouse in North Melbourne, where you could drink, hang out and have your five minutes of fame. Poverty is their way of life, but music uplifts them.

results.creator_credit: Laura Hunter and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A spooky story of trickery and revenge, where good overcomes evil. Uses claymation and computer animation.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Shop 16
results.creator_credit: Shawn Reece, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Shawn Reece had no confidence and stayed at home when he wasn’t at school. That is, until his friend convinced him to come along to Shop 16, a youth centre run by the Salvation Army in Reservoir.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shawn Reece, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Raptor
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Potter, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Cynthia Potter tells of her life in one of Melbourne’s Housing Commission flats and her beloved son Elvis. Energetic, with a passion for insects, Elvis makes the most of life, while Potter does the best she can with what she’s got.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cynthia Potter, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Tail
results.creator_credit: Yung Ting Lao and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

Amusing 2-D and 3-D computer animated tale about tails and their eventual destination as trophies on a wall. No dialogue.

results.title: Nothing impossible
results.creator_credit: Aden Daud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When his country was thrown into civil war, Aden Daud’s friends would tell him to just waiting for his time to die. Instead, Daud decided to do something about it and seek out a more secure life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aden Daud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
